## Explanation

Much as we would love to cover everything to do with R Shiny, it is simply not possible given the time we have today. However, if this workshop inspired you to delve further into Shiny, we hope that the resources and readings below are helpful to you.

Thanks for coming to our workshop!

-- Gabe, Francisco, & Nick

## Further Reading

- [Mastering Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/basic-app.html) by Hadley Wickham

- [Deploying a Shiny App](https://shiny.rstudio.com/deploy/) FAQ

## Deployed Shiny Apps

- [Data submission portal](https://herbvar.shinyapps.io/data_portal_actual/) for the Herbivory Variability Network

- `lterpalettefinder` [demo app](https://cosima.nceas.ucsb.edu/lterpalettefinder-shiny/)

-[WeatherSpark](https://weatherspark.com/) The Weather Year Round Anywhere on Earth:
Climate reports with the weather by month, day, even hour. Great for event and trip planning!

-[Wisconsin's Long-Term Water Quality Trends](https://wisconsindnr.shinyapps.io/riverwq/). How government agencies take advantage of the functionality of Shiny Apps to offer an interactive view of their long-term data sets.
